p: O. basilicum EO, methyl chavicol, linalool and neem oil caused significant difference on OAI. O. basilicum EO, methyl chavicol at 0.25% caused an OAI −0.81 + 0.01 and −0.67 + 0.03, respectively. All the samples tested at 0.15 and 0.05 % recorded OAI value below −0.5. An OAI value from −0.5 to −1 is an indication of good ovipositional repellence effect. In the case of neem oil, all the doses tested had OAI less than −0.5 (F 11,36 = 53.87 P < 0.001) (Table 2).
